cleaned_text: The Tree of Life has become an archetype, appearing across cultures as a spiritual and philosophical symbol. Its meaning is rooted in its unchanging and dependable nature. - It was under the Bodhi tree that Buddha attained Enlightenment. - It's the source of eternal life in the Garden of Eden. - In Norse cosmology, it is Ygdrassil, the world tree that connects all the nine worlds. - It is the fountain of knowledge, the connector of heaven and Earth, that carries the secret to immortality. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ Made with different crystals, each Chakra Tree brings specific energy into any given space. They're noted for healing, bringing good energy or chi, and aiding dream manifestation. They represent the tree of life with crystals as the leaves, bearing different kinds of energy and purpose depending on the type of stone used. ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ CHAKRA BALANCE CRYSTAL TREE It's common to mix and match crystals to create a synergistic effect. Multi-stone leaves represent each chakra and assists with aligning your energy for better physical, mental, and emotional health. The wire branches can be bent into the shape of a tree you desire. Crystal chips on the tree are: Red Jasper to represent Root Chakra Carnelian to represent Sacral Chakra Yellow Aventurine to represent Solar Plexus Chakra Green Aventurine to represent Heart Chakra Lapis Lazuli to represent Throat Chakra Sodalite to represent Third Eye Chakra Amethyst to represent Crown Chakra ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ The tree measures approximately. 25cm in height and has a wooden base.
